poem:
**A Call in Liverpool**

child's cry  
echoes,  
silent loss in  
the city's heart,  
left unguarded—  
a vacant space.  
across cobblestones,  
whispers rise,  
urging needles' gentle prick—  
a weave of love  
to mend  
what's frayed,  
secure a future  
bright, unblemished  
by shadows of  
the past  
where protection  
was once  
forgotten.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Parents urged to get children vaccinated after measles death in Liverpool Health officials have urged people to come forward for the measles vaccine if they are not up to date with their shots after a child at Alder Hey children’s hospital in Liverpool died from the disease. The city has experienced a surge in cases among young people, with the hospital warning parents last week that the spike in infections was due to falling rates". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Parents urged to get children vaccinated after measles death in Liverpool Health officials have urged people to come forward for the measles vaccine if they are not up to date with their shots after a child at Alder Hey children’s hospital in Liverpool died from the disease. The city has experienced a surge in cases among young people, with the hospital warning parents last week that the spike in infections was due to falling rates
